runs.comm: ovepitched and the mighty Hash has smoked it through the covers! Leans forward and takes full toll of the loose delivery
gets across on middle and off to punch a back of a length delivery into the covers
bat face closes as it makes impact with one that is just short of a good length. Seemed like Amla was into his back foot cover drive too early
banged in short and a shade outside off, Hash slips under it
back of a lenght and outside off, left for the keeper
fuller delivery with a hint of movement away, Amla decides on an on-the-up drive and misses
flatter delivery from around the wicket, punched down to long-on
flatter delivery on off stump, pushed to mid-on
goes back and whips a good length ball to deep midwicket
a shade outside off on a full length as well, de Kock pushes into the covers. Doesn't quite move the feet yet
pushed back at the bowler
tossed up on the pads and de Kock nudges it to short midwicket. Good work there
goes short and Amla loads up for the pull. The ball reached him quicker than he expected to chip some of his timing away. Finds a couple to deep midwicket
back of a length and nipping away off the deck, Amla doesn't move his feet and pokes outside off. Beaten
short and wide, Amla flays it to deep third man
moves around the wicket and nails a toe-crusher. Speared in from quite wide and it comes in quite sharply with the angle. De Kock manages to flick it to square leg and smiles having survived a beauty
good length ball on off stump, blocked
gets across on off stump and turns a back of a length ball on off stump into the perfect delivery to flick off the hips
gets a good length ball to come in at Amla, who is happy to turn it down to long leg
sliced through point and his timing is quite striking. Hint of width and he's chopped it through the gap. Nods to his partner, he knows that was the shot that could get him back in form
creamed through point again! he looks like he's the one smoking hundreds four matches in a row! A little short, a little wide and dispatched
back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-off

worked from outside off to the midwicket boundary, a la his opening partner and his predecessor (Greame Smith). Goes back and flicks a good length ball on top of the bounce and he times the ball so sweetly
stays beside the ball, camps on the back foot and taps a shortish delivery into the covers
shortish and outside off, Amla goes back and across and works it through midwicket
searing, inswinging yorker at the base of middle stump. Deserved a wicket but de Kock is stubborn. Terrific ball, Immense skill from the batsman too

slower ball, ends up a full toss outside off, slid to the point boundary. That really shouldn't have reached the rope. It looked like de Kock was reaching, he barely struck the ball, it was just placement...
looks for another yorker, but just misses the mark. De Kock whips it through midwicket's legs. Terrible work from Kusal Perera. Oh, and Malinga had overstepped as well. Very tight call
comes over the wicket for a free hit nails a yorker a shade outside off, sliced into the covers
another yorker seeking middle stump, de Kock moves his feet out of the way to remove lbw out of play and pushes down the ground
change of pace, good length ball angled across the left-hander and de Kock is into his push a touch too early. Beaten
tossed up down the leg side, Amla must have got a little bit of pad to it
tossed up on middle and leg, defended
goes back to a flatter delivery on off stump and punches to mid-off
flighted on middle, Amla takes it on the full and flicks it behind square leg. Deep midwicket has to run around and cut it short of the boundary
good length ball on middle and leg, tucked behind square leg. His action is certainly like Murali's, but he's not turning the ball
there we go, a hint of movement away from the batsman and de Kock is beaten. Had tried to knock it to third man, didn't look convincing
fuller delivery on off stump, Amla simply caresses it down the ground past mid-off for a couple
the slingy arm fails there as the shortish delivery wanders away wide of off stump
fullish on off stump, blocked
back of a length and outside off, Amla is happy to see it off to the keeper

Kula runs around, dives and takes a beautiful catch at deep third man! The umpire's are checking the front foot, has he overstepped?! This is seriously tight! Seriously tight. And the benefit of the doubt goes to the bowler. Amla's gone. It was short and wide, he went for a cut and didn't bother with keeping it down. The fielder ran around, had his eyes on the ball all the way and claimed it excellently. And that's the supper break
full length, wide of the stumps and that's in de Kock's spank-me zone, leans out to larrup a drive through cover point
well-diredted bouncer to follow up, the batsman jerks underneath it
sliding through from around the wicket, plays back defensively outside off
flatter and a touch quicker on the stumps, du Plessis stays in the crease and nudges to leg, gets off the mark
tossed up, not much turn and de Kock defends around off stump
shuffles across and plays a length ball back towards the man coming in at mid-off
flighted, dipping towards middle and off and straightening a touch, de Kock leans out and defends watchfully
gives this some air again, lots of wrist going into Kaushal's deliveries, though minimal grip so far, de Kock again defends on the front foot
shortish and in the channel outside off, du Plessis dabs this down behind gully and they hustle back for a second
slung down in the corridor, leaving the batsman and he watches it through
shortish length, stays back and opens the face, runs the ball along the ground to third slip
dug in short again, sits up for du Plessis to paddle around the corner for one through square
continues with the bouncer attack, leaping off that awkward trajectory at around 138kph, de Kock swipes at it but fails to connect

Malinga has overstepped and he's also been swatted over midwicket by de Kock, takes on the short ball again and gets hold of this one, maybe off the toe but cleared the infield and nearly went all the way to the boundary
another extra, Malinga is giving SA room to breathe - slings this wide in the channel
low arm, skidding through outside off, close to the tramlines again but Nigel Llong gives him this one
flighted on the stumps, closes the face and whips through square leg
tossed up outside off, du Plessis reaches out and strokes a couple into the gap between backward point and cover
a chance?! Maybe not... The ball didn't go to hand but short leg was interested, signs of some spin for Kaushal but think it only flicked the thigh pad
gets out and punches one more in front of square
angled in and straightening on the stumps, defends to the on side
drops just a fraction short and de Kock rocks back to clock it through backward point, really socked it and the ball races away
starts slightly short and pushed into a gap in the covers
slightly overpitched in the channel outside off and de Kock skelps another boundary, using Dushmantha's pace to crump a cover drive for four
short now and pulled away - this was touching 145kph/90mph but de Kock is seeing it big and whipped his hands through the shot. Called for a front-foot no-ball, too, though it looked tight
good comeback, slips in a fast yorker outside off, de Kock was back on his heels and couldn't get the bat down
a bumper this time, fast and climbing but down the leg side
banged in halfway down and de Kock slaps another dismissive pull through square, there's a man out there as cover now
full and straight, tailing towards leg stump and clipped away fore a couple more through backward square
short again, boinging up and high over du Plessis' cross-batted slash... Sangakkara appeals but there's some kidology involved there, I think, definitely a wide on height
fuller and in the channel, thickish outside edge squirts away down to third man
stays back and works the ball away towards midwicket
some gasps among the Sri Lanka fielders as de Kock pushes forward and the ball loops back in front of square leg... might have been some glove invovled but it fell safely
flighted, nice and slow, de Kock gets low and paddles one through short fine leg
oof, done him, for no reward! Pushed through a little flatter outside off, du Plessis goes for a big drive and is beaten. Doosra?
tossed up and spinning back in as du Plessis gets forward to defend
floated up and du Plessis carefully pats back down the track once again
pitched up and dispatched back down the ground, lovely timing from de Kock, stroking an on-drive to the boundary
Dushmantha has changed his angle, bowling around the wicket, slings this waaaaaaaaaaaay down the leg side and Sanga can't get to it

done him for pace but it goes for four more! De Kock was a little cramped trying to hook a short ball, it rose higher than he expected, zinged the top of his helmet and disappeared over the cordon for leg byes
short again, he's going at it hammer and tongs but de Kock has been smelted from strong stuff and he batters a pull to deep square leg
fullish this time and in the channel, du Plessis elects to leave it alone
angled in and worked away to the leg side
bouncer, fired down the leg side again - this time Sanga keeps the damage to one

another short ball, little less gas behind this one and pulled comfortably along the ground to deep backward square - that's de Kock's fifty, just a momentary acknowledgement but what a handy knock this has been, looking like a match-winner for South Africa in a knockout match. There, I said it
tossed up, gets down low and sweeps a couple behind square
around the wicket, flighted and played back down the track
tossed up, comes forward and punches one down the ground
gets forward and defends a flighted delivery
full outside the line of off and du Plessis taps one down the ground, brings up three figures for SA
there's a whirl of arms, the ball drifts in towards the pads, de Kock pushes to mid-on
starts a touch short and the batsman goes back and across to defend
fuller, around off stump, pushed into the covers as du Plessis shuffles forwards
goes short, not much quicker than 130kph/80mph, de Kock whistles a pull away for four more through midwicket
pushed wider, on a length, sits back and cracks a cut shot in front of square, only picks out the man set back at cover
goes big, huuuuuuge roundhouse pull out towards deep midwicket, where Kusal Perera very nearly pulls off a sensational diving catch... but only succeeds in punching it to the rope for four more
slower ball, comes out wrong, down the leg side
slightly back of a length outside off and de Kock swings and misses
slightly short to begin with, du Plessis stays in the crease and crunches a couple through the covers
on the stumps, flicked off the pads to midwicket
flat delivery outside off, slapped off the back foot through the covers for two
tossed up, de Kock skips out and chips a drive over the bowler's head, long-on comes across to prevent four
tight line, skidding on to the pads as de Kock looked to work it away
angled in with the arm, turned away through square leg
signs of turn for Kaushal, takes the outside edge as de Kock pushed forwards, wasn't to the pitch but the nick died and ran away to third man
around the wicket, floated up and straightening a touch on middle and off, defended
flighted, around off stump, du Plessis lunges forward and there's bat and pad involved, not sure which was first muted appeal from SL but Llong isn't interested
too straight this time, just a tickle of bat and it runs fine for a couple
another appeal, this time for a bat-pad catch at short leg, du Plessis played down the wrong line and the ball ballooned up... don't think there was any glove on it
du Plessis is definitely struggling a little with Kaushal here, tries to hit his away out and is beaten again, the ball skidding through outside off, not far wide of the timber
starrs short and slightly wide, floaty slower-ball bouncer, cut imperiously away through backward point
pitched up in the channel, opens the face and runs to third man
short again and chopped through point for a couple more
banged, de Kock wafts at it, judged to be too high again - another extra donated to the SA anti-choke fund
slung in short of a length again, again de Kock fails to get anything on it
goes full, around the line of off, dipping towards the blockhole but de Kock drops his bat on it

slower ball outside off, de Kock thrashes it away through the covers - that's it, those are the winning runs, South Africa win by nine wickets, they win a knockout game at a World Cup for the first time, they're into the semi-finals!
